A: A hackathon is 'coding marathon'. Participants form groups of one to four people and spend 24 hours developing whatever project excites them. Through workshops, mentors, mini-events, and teambuilding, participants will be able to create their project, grow their network, and learn exciting new concepts all in one night.
Anything! We've seen AI, games, websites, design/animations, and hardware. However, we encourage you take on a project that's 'outside-the-box'

Q: How do I find a team?
A: If you have a team of friends already, you are good to go: you should all apply individually and you will work together at the event. However, you absolutely do not need to come in with a team! We will network and make sure everyone has a team before the event starts.
Hack Ridge is open to all high school students! Younger applicants may apply; however, admission is not guaranteed. College students may apply to be mentors.
It's completely free! We will provide food, swag, and more.
You will need a computer, chargers, a high school ID, and some enthusiasm!
Hack Ridge will be located at Maine South High School at 1111 South Dee Road, Park Ridge, IL. We will be in the cafeteria on the north side of the campus.
You may provide your own transportation to Maine South, or request transportation.

Q: What if I have a question not answered here?
A: No problem! Shoot us an email at info@hackridge.io
